statement.p: Let V be the set of all pairs of numbers (x_1,y_1)\in\mathbb{R}^2 together with the operations (x_1,y_1)\oplus (x_2,y_2)&= (3x_1+x_2, y_1+1y_2)c \odot (x_1,y_1) &= (cx_1,cy_1) Show that scalar multiplication distributes over vector addition, i.e. c\odot \left((x_1,y_1)\oplus(x_2,y_2)\right)=c\odot(x_1,y_1)\oplus c\odot(x_2,y_2).. Show that V nonetheless is not a vector space.

answer.p: V is not a vector space because Scalar multiplication does not distribute over scalar addition
